pullRequest.title: Sync assemblies
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description of changes
Added the ability to synchornize remote GenomeAssemblies when synchronizing a project.
To test this PR, upload some assemblies to a sample in a project, they synchronize it using the sync project features.  Ensure the assembly gets sync'd.  If you want to go further, run the assembly pipeline to generate another assembly and ensure it gets sync'd too.
Related issue
Fixes #123
Checklist
Things for the developer to confirm they've done before the PR should be accepted:

 CHANGELOG.md (and UPGRADING.md if necessary) updated with information for new change.
 Tests added (or description of how to test) for any new features.
 User documentation updated for UI or technical changes.

commit.message: added ability to remote sync assemblies
rolling back temporary sync speed change
added javadoc comments to repos and services

checking if assemblies have been sync'd before and preventing
duplication
added which data is being sync'd from remote IRIDAs in the docs
added unit test for syncing assembly
fixed visibility of token service in the repo

nodes.bodyText: Change this to Added functionality for users to synchronize assembly data from remote APIs.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,6 +8,7 @@ Changes
 * [Developer]: Removed deprecated Long constructor.
 * [Developer]: Updated `webpack-dev-server` to fix security vulnerability caused by `websocket-extensions` 0.1.3.
 * [UI]: Update project metadata templates listing page to use Ant Design.
+* [UI]: Allowing users to synchronize assembly data from remote APIs.

@@ -304,7 +304,22 @@ Settings for remote synchronized projects can also be managed from the project s
 Synchronizing a remote project
 ------------------------------
 
-IRIDA allows you to synchronize projects between different IRIDA installations.  A remote project appears similar to a local project, but users are not allowed to add samples or sequencing data to a remote project.  Instead all data associated with a remote project will be pulled from a remote IRIDA instance on a regular schedule.  The only data that can be managed for a remote project is the members that are allowed to view the project and associated sample data.
+IRIDA allows you to synchronize projects between different IRIDA installations.  A remote project appears similar to a local project, but users are not allowed to add samples or sequencing data to a remote project.  Instead data associated with a remote project will be updated from a remote IRIDA instance on a regular schedule.  The only data that can be managed for a remote project is the members that are allowed to view the project and associated sample data.
+
+The following data will be synchronized:
+* Basic project metadata
+* FASTQ sequencing data associated with samples
+* Assemblies associated with samples (including both assemblies created by pipeliens within IRIDA, and uploaded assemblies)

@@ -304,7 +304,22 @@ Settings for remote synchronized projects can also be managed from the project s
 Synchronizing a remote project
 ------------------------------
 
-IRIDA allows you to synchronize projects between different IRIDA installations.  A remote project appears similar to a local project, but users are not allowed to add samples or sequencing data to a remote project.  Instead all data associated with a remote project will be pulled from a remote IRIDA instance on a regular schedule.  The only data that can be managed for a remote project is the members that are allowed to view the project and associated sample data.
+IRIDA allows you to synchronize projects between different IRIDA installations.  A remote project appears similar to a local project, but users are not allowed to add samples or sequencing data to a remote project.  Instead data associated with a remote project will be updated from a remote IRIDA instance on a regular schedule.  The only data that can be managed for a remote project is the members that are allowed to view the project and associated sample data.
+
+The following data will be synchronized:
+* Basic project metadata
+* FASTQ sequencing data associated with samples
+* Assemblies associated with samples (including both assemblies created by pipeliens within IRIDA, and uploaded assemblies)
+* Sample metadata
+
+The following data **will not** be synchronized:
+* Analysis pipeline results
+* Users & groups on a project
+* Analysis automation settings
+* Reference files
+* FAST5 data associated with samples
+
+Some of the above items that are not currently synchronized are expected to be avaliable in future IRIDA versions.

commit.message: reworeded docs and fixed some typos
